questions.question_text: Which two are true about an "editable" interactive grid? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
I've checked on my test project, and on APEX 23.1 are correct A, B, E.

(A is correct if we don't count on the columns with checkbox and selector that APEX creates automatically).

the answer is B&E
 insert or update multiple records at a time
and defined Dynamic Action
I think that you can insert or update multiple records at a time. A and B are the correct options.
Of course you can insert multiple records at a time. And you can update more than one record at a time. Correct: BE

choices.D: You can update only one record at a time
choices.B: You can insert multiple records at a time
choices.E: You can include dynamic actions on a column

choices.A: Under Authentication, select Single Sign On (SSO).
choices.D: Update Advanced Settings to specify authentication.
choices.B: Include a Sign-In page in the list of pages.

questions.question_text:
Jane is creating a new application. Users of the application will use SSO to authenticate. SSO has been defined for the instance.
Which step should Jane perform in the Create Application Wizard?

discussion.content: A is correct - C is about authorization (role based access control)

Not C - Access Control - its about authorization. Question is about Authentication. If SSO authentication schema is already defined, one will be able to chose this under Authentication -> SSO. 
A is right answer,

questions.question_text: Which three actions can be performed in Object Browser? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: i think AEG: you cannot "enable/disable" indexes, you can "create/drop" them
Actually it's ADEFG so only 2 answers are uncorrect

choices.B: Write a SQL statement to update data in a table.
choices.G: Review the SQL statement for an existing table.
choices.C: Review the storage clause for a table or view.

questions.question_text:
Jason has developed an app for maintaining customers. He has a navigation menu for customers that he needs to associate with multiple pages.
How can Jason associate one list entry with multiple pages?

choices.D: Add additional list entries labeled Customers.
choices.A: Set List Entry Current for Pages Type to "Comma Delimited Page List."
choices.B: Update the list entry User Defined Attribute 01 to "MULTIPLE", and User Defined Attribute 02 to the list of pages.
choices.E: Update list entry Condition Type to "Current Page Is Contained Within Expression 1 (comma delimited list of pages)."
choices.C: Update each page and set Current Navigation Menu Entry to "Customers".
Authorization Scheme: {Not Reader Rights}; Authentication: Page Is Public
choices.B: Authorization Scheme: Null; Authentication: Page is Public
choices.A: Authorization Scheme: Reader Rights; Authentication: Page Requires Authentication
choices.D: Authorization Scheme: Must Not Be Public User; Authentication: Page Requires Authentication

questions.question_text:
Francisco has been tasked with creating a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) page. The page security requirements are defined as:
âœ‘ Anyone who can access the application, in any capacity, shall also be able to view the new FAQ page.
Which page level Authorization Scheme and Authentication options should Francisco choose?
